title: Ticket #4110: condor_q should show MATCH_EXP_JobDescription if present
description:
Currently condor_q will show JobDescription if present in the job ad. If MATCH_EXP_JobDescription is present, it should be preferred. JobDescription might make use of $$ expressions, which are stored in evaluated form in MAX_EXP_JobDescription.

For example, if a Cluster has multiple jobs (multiple "Processes"), they'll be numbered from 0. The user might think of their jobs as starting from 1. (Or maybe 274548, because they're continuing from previous runs.) They might set JobDescription to something like "BigRun $$([$(Process)+1]). The desire is to see 

  105688.52  adesmet      12/9  0+00:23:35 R  0   268.6 (BigRun 53 )

instead of what you see today: 

  105688.52  adesmet      12/9  0+00:23:35 R  0   268.6 (BigRun $$([52+1]) )
